data.title: [folding] Make hiding of the folding gutter configurable

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: all
- OS Version:all

When I use Code on a touch-enabled device with a stylus rather than a mouse, it is very difficult to use the folding gutter, as it is hidden unless the pointer is hovering over it. While having that gutter hidden when I am not using it nicely reduces visual noise, there are times that I need it to always be there.

Why not provide a configuration item that allows the user to switch between having it be always visible or only visible on hover?

data.title: [Go] Command not available warning messages displaying after installing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

On first time use the Go extension is constantly showing a warning to install gocode and golint even after installing and restarting Code. Any way to fix this?

data.title: Cmd+D doesn't select multilines as expected
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.1.1 (1.1.1) def9e32467ad6e4f48787d38caf190acbfee5880
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a buffer with the following content:

```
func noname() {}
panic("lol")

func noname() {}
panic("lol")


func noname() {}
panic("lol")
func noname() {}
panic("lol")
```
1. Select `"func noname() {}\npanic(\"lol\")"` and press `Cmd+D` to try to select the multiple instances of the string `"func noname() {}\npanic(\"lol\")"`.
2. It doesn't work.
3. Try the same thing in Atom or Sublime Text; it works.

A gif that demonstrates the difference in behavior: 

![derp](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1189716/15412867/49c595ac-1df9-11e6-8d81-b6f94e1efdd7.gif)

Thanks!

data.title: Allow to open different windows with different permissions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 1511 (10586.318)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Close all Code instances, then run Code as administrator (a new blank Code instance with administrator right)
2. In File Explorer, right click a text file and Open with Code, nothing will happen.

Note: there are multiple other ways to trigger this issue, the above repro is just an example.
Note 2: If you already have a code instance running without administrator running, the above issue will not get triggered. That's why the very first step is to close all Code instances.

data.title: Invalid syntax highlight in clojure language with #"\\" regexp
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version:  OS X 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. change language mode to clojure in editor
2. Write `#"\\"` regexp somewhere, for ex. `'(#"\\" 3 "" 4 5)` or 

``` clojure
(defn decode-embed-json
  [^String s]
  (-> s
      (string/replace #"\\" "")
      json/read-str))
```

(even github has this issue, lol)
1. Instead of proper hightlighting we see this 
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/91045/15409960/1a7accbe-1e39-11e6-8e1a-40b609befa99.png)

data.title: How do I get Electron/Chromium logs from a production build?
data.body:
cc @bpasero @joaomoreno 

I can get what seems to be a VSCode log by running directly from the binary instead of bin command using `--verbose`:

```
❯ /usr/share/code/code --verbose
bash: cannot set terminal process group (-1): Inappropriate ioctl for device
bash: no job control in this shell
(1:58:53 PM) ### VSCode main.js ###
(1:58:53 PM) /usr/share/code/resources/app { pathArguments: [],
  programStart: 0,
  enablePerformance: false,
  verboseLogging: true,
  debugExtensionHostPort: undefined,
  debugBrkExtensionHost: false,
  logExtensionHostCommunication: false,
  debugBrkFileWatcherPort: undefined,
  openNewWindow: false,
  openInSameWindow: false,
  gotoLineMode: false,
  diffMode: false,
  extensionsHomePath: undefined,
  extensionDevelopmentPath: undefined,
  extensionTestsPath: undefined,
  disableExtensions: false,
  locale: undefined,
  waitForWindowClose: false }
(1:58:54 PM) IPC#vscode:startCrashReporter
(1:58:55 PM) IPC#vscode-workbenchLoaded
(1:58:55 PM) IPC#vscode:toggleDevTools
(1:59:03 PM) Lifecycle#window-before-close 1
(1:59:03 PM) Lifecycle#unload() 1

(1:59:03 PM) Lifecycle#window-all-closed
(1:59:03 PM) Lifecycle#before-quit
(1:59:03 PM) App#will-quit: disposing resources
```

Is it possible to get Electron/Chromium logs like in `./scripts/code.sh` like we used to be able to?

```
❯ ./scripts/code.sh .
[5893:0519/135843:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(217)] Running without the SUID sandbox! See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/linux_suid_sandbox_development.md for more information on developing with the sandbox on.

bash: no job control in this shell
[5893:0519/135846:INFO:CONSOLE(207)] "%c[Extension Host] %cdebugger listening on port 5870", source: file:////home/daimms/dev/Microsoft/vscode/out/vs/workbench/services/thread/electron-browser/threadService.js (207)
[5893:0519/135850:WARNING:x11_util.cc(1407)] X error received: serial 215, error_code 3 (BadWindow (invalid Window parameter)), request_code 40, minor_code 0 (X_TranslateCoords)
```

data.title: Watch for deletes in files opened outside workspace

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: `1.1.0`
- OS Version: `OSX El Capitan Version 10.11.4`

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create directory X
2. In X, create file, `test1.cs`
3. Open test1.cs in VS Code
4. In a terminal, run `mv test1.cs ..`
5. Switch to VS Code and edit test1.cs.
6. VS Code creates test1.cs again rather than raising an error.

data.title: breakpoint problem with files in a directory with /src as name
data.body:
Typescript: Version 1.8.10
On mac osx 10.11.5
Vscode 1.1.1

I don't know if this is a vscode or typescript issue.

I have a project with ts compiling to js with sourcemaps. 
All was working fine until I decided to move all custom project code files (except app.ts) into a /src directory:

Before: 

/app.ts (in project root)
/apps/directory/controller.ts
/afile.ts

After:

/app.ts (not moved)
/src/apps/directory/controller.ts
/src/afile.ts

After moving the files, any breakpoint set in files in /src would become black with message  “Breakpoint ignored becasue generated code not found (source map problem?). This is strange because project was working properly, which proves js files were generated and used. Breakpoints on unmoved app.ts were ok.

renaming /src to anything else (actually /source ) solved the problem.
Not sure if the problem was because directory was named specifically /src or not.

data.title: extensions: Ensure make uses tab instead of space.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
This change addresses the following issues:

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6447
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4815

It was not clear to me how to write an automated test for this change. All testing was done manually. When editing a Makefile, now the default is to use tabs instead of spaces. Switching to another file/type, and then back to the Makefile does not alter this behavior. Quitting and restarting the editor also does not alter this behavior. If an automated test is required, please point me to an example so that I can replicate it.

   ![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/677007/15396595/cf264768-1daa-11e6-8c34-57668e30f546.png)

   ![my folder_002](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/677007/15396615/db9d7250-1daa-11e6-8819-29176f801bf9.png)

   ![my - visual studio code_002](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/677007/15396637/ee0d4172-1daa-11e6-8497-6cff48993780.png)

data.title: Better default position for message in problem matchers
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1

It would be better to use 0 as the default location for a message in a problem pattern. This will capture the whole message.

data.title: Support file problem markers in tasks.json
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1

Currently problem can only reported on [file, location]. However for test frameworks it would be nice to report a problem on the file since typically no location information is available. To support this the problem matcher should provide a kind property which support "file" and "location". See also https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/5416

data.title: Bug fix 3077
data.body:
Provide following support for css variables
- Coloring
- Intellisense
- Peek and Go to

Also provide the same for css variables in sass and less

Unit test covered

data.title: Test: Editor stacks
data.body:
**Note** for endgame master: this test plan item is rather large.
- [x] Win - **@stevencl** 
- [x] OS X - **@jrieken**
- [x] Linux - **@joaomoreno**

Special build download links:
- [Windows](https://az764295.vo.msecnd.net/alpha/0328617088e0e54142521de50ed8c70836b79539/VSCodeSetup-alpha.exe)
- [OS X](https://az764295.vo.msecnd.net/alpha/0328617088e0e54142521de50ed8c70836b79539/VSCode-darwin-alpha.zip)
- [Linux](https://az764295.vo.msecnd.net/alpha/0328617088e0e54142521de50ed8c70836b79539/vscode-amd64.deb)

To prepare for enabling tabs we have introduced **editor stacks** in the workbench. Editor stacks surface in two areas of the user interface: the newly introduced **Opened Editors** view in the explorer (replaces **Working Files**) and generally in the **editor area** to the right. We still support a maximum of 3 editor groups, each having their own stack of editors that were opened.

**Note**: please test with auto save turned off!

**Pro**: you can bind `_workbench.printStacksModel` to a key to print the stacks model as plain text to console. you can bind `_workbench.validateStacksModel` to quickly check if the stacks model is in bad shape. This is helpful when filing a bug when you notice stale state between the stacks model and the UI.

**Verify:**
- each editor group has a **stack of editors** attached to it
  - the stack grows when you open editors and pin them (italics indicates preview state)
  - you can pin editors e.g. by changing contents in the file 
  - closing an editor reveals the previous editor you looked at (MRU order)
  - you can see a list of editors in the stack from the overflow action (double arrow down icon)
  - you can work with the group from the overflow dropdown menu ("..." icon)
  - you can still move groups around to reorder them
  - you can use `Ctrl+Tab` to navigate tabs in MRU order
  - you can use `CtrlCmd+Alt+Tab` to navigate all editors in spatial order
  - you can use <kbd>CtrlCmd Shift T</kbd> to reopen a closed (pinned) editor
  - normal quick open history works as before and shows you a linear history of editors opened even after you closed editors
- the **opened editors** view always reflects the state of stacks in the editor area
  - if you have more than one group, you will see the list separated by groups
  - actions in the context menu on groups and editors make sense
  - you can DND editors between groups, within groups and from the explorer
  - you can configure the maximum number of visible entries and the dynamic sizing in settings
  - you can hide the view completely via settings (`explorer.openEditors.visible`)
- in **general**
  - you see dirty indicators when changing files (or untitled) and get prompted to save on close (including closing all editors or an entire group)
  - all UI state is preserved and restored on restart
  - opened editors view and editors in general t react to file changes (delete, move, etc.)
  - you can still drag and drop multiple files into Code to open them
  - you can still open multiple files when starting from command line

Be **creative** and try to break the editor stacks model by doing some crazy stuff
    \* please keep the steps in mind that lead you to breakage if possible when filing issue

data.title: Take care of disposing embedded models in editors
data.body:
Find a way to handle what https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/6d7acce52f990fe0c77485388b3498e538109ec2 did in the new stacks world.

Maybe upon close() a file editor input needs to check if the thing is being attached to an editor still before disposing it.

data.title: gulp not found for tasks when using custom location for global installs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Linux Mint 17.3

Steps to Reproduce:
1. set npm globals to custom location; e.g. **npm config set prefix '~/.npm-global'**
2. change $PATH to put custom npm global folder first
3. install gulp and other globals modules to custom location

If I try to run a task, the following message is received...even though npm ls -g confirms gulp is installed properly...
_Gulp is not installed on your system. Run npm install -g gulp to install it._

If I install gulp as global to the root location, then the task will run properly

Thanks,
David
